title: The Mission and Mercy
shortSummary: Luke 10 records Jesus commissioning the seventy disciples to spread the gospel, emphasizing the urgency of the harvest and the challenges they will face. It also includes the parable of the Good Samaritan, teaching the meaning of true neighborly love, and concludes with the story of Mary and Martha, illustrating the priority of spiritual devotion over busy service.
timeline: c. AD 27-30 - Jesus' Ministry in Galilee

keyCharacters.name: Jesus
keyCharacters.description: The Son of God who commissions the seventy disciples, teaches about the kingdom of God, and reveals truths about mercy and discipleship.

keyCharacters.name: The Seventy Disciples
keyCharacters.description: Followers sent out by Jesus in pairs to preach, heal, and prepare the way for His coming to various towns.

keyCharacters.name: The Lawyer
keyCharacters.description: A teacher of the law who tests Jesus with a question about inheriting eternal life, prompting the parable of the Good Samaritan.

keyCharacters.name: The Good Samaritan
keyCharacters.description: A compassionate outsider who exemplifies true neighborly love by caring for a wounded man, illustrating Jesus' teaching on mercy.

keyCharacters.name: Martha and Mary
keyCharacters.description: Two sisters who receive Jesus; Martha is busy with service while Mary chooses to listen to Jesus, highlighting the importance of spiritual focus.

definitions.definition: A metaphor for the readiness of people to receive the gospel and the need for workers to bring them into God's kingdom.
An expression describing the vulnerability and danger the disciples will face as they enter hostile environments to preach.
A person who welcomes the message of peace and the kingdom of God, receiving the disciples and their ministry.
A Jewish expert in the Mosaic Law who interprets and teaches the Scriptures, often testing Jesus with theological questions.
In Jesus' teaching, anyone in need whom we are called to love and show mercy to, transcending ethnic and social boundaries.

outline.heading: The Sending of the Seventy
outline.description: Jesus appoints seventy disciples and sends them out in pairs to prepare towns for His arrival, instructing them on how to conduct themselves and respond to acceptance or rejection. This section highlights the urgency of the gospel mission and the spiritual realities involved.

outline.heading: The Return of the Seventy and Jesus’ Praise
outline.description: The seventy return rejoicing over their spiritual authority, and Jesus responds by affirming their victory over evil and revealing the Father’s special revelation to the humble. He blesses the disciples for witnessing what many prophets longed to see.

outline.heading: The Lawyer’s Question and the Parable of the Good Samaritan
outline.description: A lawyer tests Jesus about inheriting eternal life, leading Jesus to affirm love for God and neighbor as the greatest commandments. Jesus then teaches the parable of the Good Samaritan to define true neighborly love as merciful action beyond social prejudices.

outline.heading: Martha and Mary’s Example
outline.description: Jesus visits the home of Martha and Mary, where Martha is distracted by serving while Mary listens attentively. Jesus teaches that spiritual devotion and hearing His word are the 'one thing needful' that will not be taken away.

application: Pray earnestly for more workers to be sent into the spiritual harvest fields, recognizing the great need for gospel laborers.
Show mercy and love to all people, regardless of social or ethnic boundaries, following the example of the Good Samaritan.
Prioritize time in God’s Word and in His presence over being overly distracted by service or busyness.
Rejoice not merely in spiritual victories or gifts but in the assurance that your name is written in heaven.

keyVerses.text: Therefore said he unto them, The harvest truly is great, but the labourers are few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the urgent need for workers in God's kingdom and the importance of prayer in fulfilling the Great Commission.

keyVerses.text: And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind; and thy neighbour as thyself.
keyVerses.significance: This verse summarizes the greatest commandments, forming the foundation for Christian ethics and love.

keyVerses.text: And he said, He that shewed mercy on him. Then said Jesus unto him, Go, and do thou likewise.
keyVerses.significance: Jesus commands active mercy and compassion as the true expression of neighborly love, challenging believers to live out their faith practically.

keyVerses.text: But one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the priority of spiritual devotion and listening to Jesus over distractions, affirming what is truly essential in the Christian life.
